items.sentence: Tom called the students back into the room to tell them about the plane crash.
Tom decided that it wouldn\'t be sensible to try to cross the old rope bridge.
Tom wants to know if you\'re planning on going to Boston with us next weekend.
Tom put the bowl into the microwave and pushed the button to start it cooking.
If I hadn\'t had your cooperation, I couldn\'t have finished the work in time.
Tom must\'ve realized it was a rhetorical question, because he didn\'t answer.
Just be patient with Tom. I\'m sure he\'ll eventually make the right decision.
Tom told me that he could live off his savings for a while if he lost his job.
Tom wanted to make a mix CD of music for Mary, but all he had were DVD blanks.
Tom was afraid that Mary might poke her eye out, so he told her to be careful.
Would you mind making an extra cup of coffee whenever you decide to have some?
Tom described Mary quite well, so it was easy to recognize her when I saw her.
You can say anything you want about me, but don\'t say anything bad about Tom.
Cucumbers, spinach, broccoli and onions are considered non-starchy vegetables.
Do you really want me to tell Tom that you were the one who killed his father?
I have trouble seeing the blackboard from the seat the teacher assigned to me.
Tom stared at the envelope in Mary\'s hand, wondering who the letter was from.
Tom thought it wasn\'t a good idea to leave Mary at home without a babysitter.
A few years ago, on Mother\'s Day, I gave my stepmother a locket as a present.
Tom\'s father comes home once in a while, but he never sticks around for long.
